original: Anderson, Douglas Sigfrid Eberhard, direktör, Göteborg, f. 14/3/81 i Gbg av Bliias A. o. Sara Sdhröder. G. 05 m. Gärda Persson. Barn: Douglas f. 06. — Genomg. elem:sk., Gbgs slöjd-fören. sk., hand:sk., priv. språkstud. Res. t. Danm. 03, Norge o. Tyskl. 19-22, Engl. 31, Holl. 31. Anst. i Gbgs Morgonpost sed. 96, ekon:dir. där 11-17 o. 21-32, verkst. dir. där sed. 41. Stadsrev. i Gbgs Frihamns A-B 32-34, huv:man i Fastigh :äg. Sparbank, ordf. i styr. f. Tryckeri A-B Otterhall. Medl. av Biolog, fören. i Gbg, Odd Fellow^, Götiska förb.. Par Bricole o. W-Sex. Hobby: fågelstud.
translated: Anderson, Douglas Sigfrid Eberhard, Director, Gothenburg, born March 14, 1881 in Gothenburg to Bliias A. and Sara Sdhröder. Married in 1905 to Gärda Persson. Children: Douglas (born in 1906). He attended elementary school, Gothenburg’s Slöjdförening school, handwriting school, and had private language studies. He traveled to Denmark in 1903, Norway and Germany from 1919 to 1922, England in 1931, and Holland in 1931. He has been employed by Gothenburg’s Morgonpost since 1896, an economic director there from 1911 to 1917 and 1921 to 1932, and an executive director there since 1941. He was a city auditor for Gothenburg’s Frihamns A-B from 1932 to 1934, head of the property owner’s savings bank, and chairman of the board for Tryckeri A-B Otterhall. He is a member of the Biology Society in Gothenburg, Odd Fellows, Götiska förbundet, Par Bricole, and W-Sex. His hobby is studying birds.
